Name: code-server

Branch.TagDescription: DEPRECATED (no longer updated, `latest` is rebased on focal) - Stable releases, based on Ubuntu Focal
DEPRECATED (no longer updated) - Prereleases from their GitHub

Overview:
Code-server(https://coder.com) is VS Code running on a remote server, accessible through the browser.
- Code on your Chromebook, tablet, and laptop with a consistent dev environment.
- If you have a Windows or Mac workstation, more easily develop for Linux.
- Take advantage of large cloud servers to speed up tests, compilations, downloads, and more.
- Preserve battery life when you're on the go.
- All intensive computation runs on your server.
- You're no longer running excess instances of Chrome.

PASSWORD.Name: PASSWORD
PASSWORD.Description: Optional web gui password, if `PASSWORD` or `HASHED_PASSWORD` is not provided, there will be no auth.

HASHED_PASSWORD.Name: HASHED_PASSWORD
HASHED_PASSWORD.Description: Optional web gui password, overrides `PASSWORD`, instructions on how to create it is below.

SUDO_PASSWORD.Name: SUDO_PASSWORD
SUDO_PASSWORD.Description: If this optional variable is set, user will have sudo access in the code-server terminal with the specified password.

SUDO_PASSWORD_HASH.Name: SUDO_PASSWORD_HASH
SUDO_PASSWORD_HASH.Description: Optionally set sudo password via hash (takes priority over `SUDO_PASSWORD` var). Format is `$type$salt$hashed`.

PROXY_DOMAIN.Name: PROXY_DOMAIN
PROXY_DOMAIN.Description: If this optional variable is set, this domain will be proxied for subdomain proxying. See Documentation(https://github.com/cdr/code-server/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#sub-domains)

DEFAULT_WORKSPACE.Name: DEFAULT_WORKSPACE
DEFAULT_WORKSPACE.Description: If this optional variable is set, code-server will open this directory by default
